849565664:
[

Marketing and Supply Graduate Program

Company Name Reece Group Company Location Burwood, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 434 views

Job description


About Reece Group
Reece Group is an Australian icon. You probably know us as Australia's largest supplier of plumbing and bathroom products. We have been around for almost 100 years. But that's just one side of us. We're a major public company with over 5,000 people, 600 branches and 9 businesses in Australia and New Zealand and have just expanded to America after our recent acquisition of MORSCO. We thrive on new ideas and have the courage to make them happen. That means endless opportunities to achieve amazing things.

Our team are committed, down to earth and driven people striving for greatness every day.

We sell millions of products under hundreds of brands, many we've created. We market them expertly to loyal customers in a hungry market. So, we know marketing and sales. And we're happy to share.

Program Overview
The Reece Group Graduate Program has been rated consistently in the top 100 finalists by GradConnection. We are pleased to be recognised in the top 30 for 2018.

Check out our Graduate website to explore the program in more detail: https://www.reececareers.com.au/graduates/

Upon completion of the 24-month program, Graduates will start their role in the Marketing and Supply team in either Merchandising, Brand Marketing, Digital Marketing or Business Unit Marketing.

Here's a breakdown of the program:

  • You're allocated a mentor as you as you commence the program to guide your growth and development as you progress
  • Throughout the program you'll receive a training plan, feedback and support and ongoing training
  • In your first year, you'll immerse yourself in the business working within one or more of our 600+ stores to become an expert in our products, learn who our customers are and gain an understanding of our systems
  • Your experience will be tailored to suit you and your strengths. You'll work side-by-side with some of the best in the business with opportunities to progress your career within one of the following areas in your second year;
    • Merchandising
    • Brand Marketing
    • Digital Marketing or
    • Business Unit Marketing.


Key Selection Criteria

  • Recent University Graduates or final year students with a Business or Commerce degree with a major or minor in Marketing
  • Good marketing knowledge with an interest in current trends and industry developments.
  • An analytical focus
  • Persuasive and influential communication skills
  • Ability to problem solve and make decisions
  • Can multitask in a fast-paced environment
  • Demonstrated Leadership capabilities
  • A humble approach to work
  • A team player
  • A conscientious approach to work. With a demonstrated resilience and passion for reaching your goals.


Why Work With Us
Most organisations say they live by their values. We actually do. We also hire by them and promote by them.

They are a major reason why we are such a strong and happy company.

Take a look for yourself: https://www.reececareers.com.au/

What's In It For You
The Reece Group prioritises career development for internal staff, and demonstrated success in this role will set you up for further growth and development opportunities.

Here are some other reasons why you should consider us:

  • A permanent position at the very start of your graduate program
  • 3-day induction held in Melbourne
  • Structured learning, development and leadership programs
  • A range of employee benefits and staff discounts
  • Profit share


Application Process

  • Submit your Resume and Academic Transcript


If this sounds like the opportunity you've been looking for, we would love to hear from you. Apply today!

To be eligible for the Reece Group Graduate Program, you need to be an Australian citizen or permanent resident at the time of application. Applicants must be willing to undertake a background check and references.

Seniority Level

Entry level

Industry

  • Marketing and Advertising

Employment Type

Full-time

UX Lead

Company Name Loud & Clear Company Location 83 William Street , Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

Posted Date Posted 7 days ago Number of views 125 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Description:\xa0


Loud&Clear is a team of over 175 digital natives who love building future-ready businesses.

We do this by combining design thinking, data-driven insights and well-drilled development capabilities to build products and platforms that inspire and capture imagination.

\xa0

The sort of work we love doing is:

  • UX, CX and customer-centred design for tier one enterprises
  • React Native apps for global clients and funded startups
  • Sitecore and Acquia websites with a particular focus on retail and commerce
  • Digital Strategy and Transformations
  • Chatbot powered experiences and AI


The sort of work we don't do is:

  • EDMs and banner ads
  • Retainer campaign work
  • Social media


We are looking for an UX Lead to join our team.


Requirements:


  • I have at least 5 years of experience working in fast paced environment for digital agencies.
  • I lead UX projects and more junior members of the team when they are engaged in my projects. I drive the agency philosophy of ‘make something people love’ within the team and critically evaluate the quality of the output of the team.
  • I actively seek to find opportunities for the agency, whether it’s through identifying opportunities in prospective clients or opportunities to extend engagements with existing clients.
  • I am seen as a leader in my field, and am active in the UX community. This is executed through public speaking, teaching, and thought leadership.
  • I am endlessly curious about my craft and all aspects of User Experience, I pursue knowledge in emerging trends and technology and identify opportunities to deliver better customer experiences for the clients I work with.
  • I facilitate UX, Discovery, CX, Service Design and HCD workshops for our clients, and actively look to up-skill my team to run these too.
  • I support the UX practice lead in creating an outstanding professional environment for the XD team and our teams clients. This means I understand what high-quality UX consultancy looks like, and the tools and methodologies we use to deliver. \xa0
  • I am an 80% billable resource across multiple projects as a lead consultant and equipped with the expertise to deliver all aspects of a UX project on the required tools.
  • I am able to identify, workshop and manage up operational, and delivery issues within the projects I’m engaged in.

Senior IT Business Analyst

Company Name Treasury Wine Estates Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 497 views

Job description

About the Role


Due to the continual investment in TWE’s finance technologies we are seeking an Senior Business Analyst to join our IT team. Focused on our finance organisation you will have responsibility for the end to end BA remit including identifying the business requirements and change impacts, capturing and documenting requirements and then ensuring that those requirements are delivered by internal resources or external IT service providers. In addition you will:


  • Develop and maintain working relationships with key Finance business owners
  • Provide meaningful guidance and recommendations for maximising business effectiveness with standard process and systems
  • Lead and facilitate requirements sessions
  • Document detailed business objectives and requirements, including process mapping
  • Act as a dedicated project resource and/or project manage small to medium projects and/or multiple minor initiatives
  • Coordinate groups of business personnel who test, evaluate and validate new functions and applications, and identify issues in software or services
  • Create and manage test plans


What you’ll have


You will have proven experience as a BA with specific experience with JDE, supporting a finance client group. Agile project management leadership is a must as is relevant experience in an end to end BA role. A natural relationship builder and networker you will collaborate effectively with diverse stakeholders while being able to gain buy and credibility through customer focus and service delivery.


If you would like the opportunity to join a global organisation headquartered in Melbourne, apply now.

Administration Assistant

Company Name carsales.com.au Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 507 views

Job description

  • ASX top 100 with the heart of a start up
  • Passionate about supporting a diverse & inclusive workplace culture
  • Work for Forbes' #12 most innovative growth company in the world

Got drive? You’ll fit right in.

In 1997 we tried something new - we've been doing it ever since. From humble start-up beginnings, today we're an ASX top 100 with world-class technology and advertising solutions. Not only are we the largest online automotive, motorcycle and marine classifieds business in Australia, we're growing across Latin America and Asia.

The role

We’re on the lookout for an enthusiastic and motivated individual to support our Client Contact Centre team and work closely with our dealer clients. You’ll be the go-to person helping out with a wide range of admin related tasks and duties, ensuring that they’re completed within required timeframes.

What You’ll Do
  • Assist and work closely with our management team to provide ongoing administrative support.
  • Format documents and spreadsheets so they are suitable for printing or presentations.
  • Work with our dealer clients and assist them with moving stock, as well as any ad-hoc additional issues or enquiries that they may have.
  • Monitor and resolve any issues that are reported through the carsales site and ensure that all users are compliant with the carsales terms.
  • Work closely with the Client Contact Centre to ensure our customer service is fluid and transparent.


What We’re Looking For
  • A highly motivated team player who’s all about providing exceptional customer service experiences.
  • Someone who’s confident when it comes to fostering relationships and building rapport.
  • A self-starter multitasker who can effectively juggle multiple tasks and priorities without dropping the ball.
  • An articulate communicator with a clear speaking voice and impeccable written skills.
  • Someone who is comfortable reading and interpreting data and making decisions based on what the data says.
  • A tech savvy mindset – you pick up new systems quickly and are a whiz with Excel.


Why Apply?

carsales offers extensive opportunities to learn and evolve in a diverse, fast-paced and dynamic environment. We are committed to our people through many ongoing initiatives associated with culture and benefits, career development, health and well-being, community, work-life balance, reward and recognition. We continually strive to attract and retain the most talented people through a number of programs designed to support learning and development. When you work at carsales you don't just have a job, but you have a rewarding career.

carsales is an equal opportunity employer who prides themselves on providing a diverse workplace that brings out the best in its people. We encourage women and men of all ages and background to apply.



  • And just a quick one…
    Successful candidates joining the carsales family are required to undergo a National Police Record check and must have full-time Australian working rights on an ongoing basis.

854067110:
[

Account Manager Global

Company Name Kmart Australia Limited Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 7 days ago Number of views 602 views

Job description

At Kmart, we are where families come first for the lowest prices on everyday items and our vision is to make everyday living brighter for all our customers, every time and everywhere they shop with us.

As Australia’s brightest retail star, we have experienced great success in recent times but for Kmart this is just the beginning of our exciting journey ahead! We have big plans in place to ensure we deliver our vision and significantly expand our business. There has never been a more irresistible time to join Kmart!

We now have an opportunity for an experienced retail account manager with global experience to contribute to one of Kmart’s new channels and be part of a key growth strategy. The role of Account Manager Global is responsible for day-to-day management and coordination with selected customer accounts in Kmart’s Wholesale business to ensure we can retain and grow business. Other key responsibilities in this role will include;

  • Work closely with customer to understand customer needs and product purchasing behaviour based on market dynamics
  • Accountable for development of short and long-term business plans in conjunction with customers
  • Build strong rapport and successful relationships.
  • Manage the day-to-day communication with wholesale customers
  • Initial engagement to develop and foster a relationship with potential retail partners
  • Provide ongoing support to in-country Operations team to work collaboratively to deliver on requirements

To meet the challenges of this role, you will ideally possess the following skills and experience;

  • Prior experience in Account Management of retail clients (preferably global)
  • Strong commercial understanding in negotiating and managing retail accounts and contributing to pricing and ranging recommendations
  • Possess an understanding of the end-to-end process for running a retail business combined with wholesale experience
  • Demonstrated ability to achieve annual sales growth targets and improvement of wholesale customers stock turn
  • Demonstrated ability to business develop both new and existing retail customers on the global stage

You will benefit from joining an amazing business and a dynamic team who are all committed to the success of Kmart and providing our customers with a great shopping experience. Our values – Think Customer, Take Care, Live Integrity, Grow Together and Reach Higher will resonate with you deeply and you’ll enjoy being part of a growing, iconic Australian business that has a fantastic culture that is non-hierarchical, diverse and inclusive. Your work environment will be highly collaborative, fast-paced and progressive, with no two days the same!

You will be afforded autonomy and accountability in your role and have access to development opportunities across both Kmart and the Wesfarmers Group, excellent remuneration, inclusion in company bonus scheme & access to Wesfarmers share plan (both for eligible team members), free parking and benefits program including a discount card for Kmart, Coles, Target and Officeworks.

So if this sounds like the perfect role for you – apply now!

At Kmart we aim to ensure our teams reflect the diversity of the communities in which we operate.

Candidates interested in this position should apply directly to this advertisement as we are not accepting applications from recruitment agencies.

Industry

  • Apparel & Fashion
  • Consumer Goods
  • Retail

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Sales
  • Business Development

Job description

About the Opportunity


An exciting opportunity has been created in the role of Customer Director Coles. \xa0Based in Scoresby, this role is unique as it will have complete responsibility for all joint business relationships and initiatives across all business functions in relation to the Coles account. You will lead and drive projects that will enhance the future for this partnership.


You must have a successful track record in leading and executing key growth initiatives within the grocery sector. Key to your success is your excellent skills in customer management and the ability to work with multiple stakeholders, both internally and externally, with a business partnering approach to achieving the desired results.


Key responsibilities:


  • To develop and execute a strategic customer business plan, maximising growth opportunities across your portfolio​ through retailer alignment
  • Accountable for trading terms, achieving both revenue and profitability targets for your portfolio​
  • Planning, overseeing and leading projects from ideation through to completion
  • Managing project progress to meet expected deadlines with-in budget


Experience:


  • Experienced National Business Manager or National Account Manager looking for the next step in their career.
  • Exceptional hands-on track record of working and winning with multinationals like Woolworths/Coles or other scale customers globally
  • FMCG customer leadership in a sophisticated brand led category​
  • Influencing – work across a range of stakeholders internally and externally to lead and persuade to help deliver your plans
  • Project Management​ or managing Private Label contracts


The position is highly autonomous and requires a strong result orientated individual with sound and fast decision-making skills.


On offer is an exciting career challenge for you to make an immediate impact, career progression opportunities, and fast paced work environment, committed to succeeding and having fun whilst doing so! \xa0


If you have the ambition, drive and competency to succeed in this role please submit your application, including current resume by selecting 'Apply' and following the prompts.


No Recruitment Agencies – We have this one covered!
